plan: In the first five rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding 50% of my value. For the next five rounds, I'll try an aggressive approach by bidding 70% of my value to gather data on potential profit increases. In the final five rounds, I'll employ a mixed strategy, alternating between 50% and 70% bids based on observed patterns in Betty's and Charles' behavior. Throughout, I'll track the outcomes to determine which strategy yields the highest profit and adjust accordingly. This approach balances exploration and exploitation to maximize long-term profit.

In the initial rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding 50% of my value. I'll then explore more aggressive strategies, such as bidding 70% of my value when my value is above $50, to gather data on competitors' behaviors. For values under $30, I'll test conservative bids around 30% to minimize losses. Mid-game, I'll analyze opponents' tendencies and adjust accordingly, possibly testing extreme bids (near $99) when my value is high to secure wins. I'll also try underbidding (around 20%) in some rounds to observe reactions, aiming for strategic advantage in later rounds.
